name: 歐洲現況專題研究
goals: to read the common threads that weave together the major narratives and visions of cities in the pre-modern age in Europe.
discuss alternating conceptualizations of modernity and the way modernity has shaped the evolutions of European cities
to visually explore several major European cities, with a view to providing the concrete ground for discussion and analysis
syllabus:
1.  Introduction: back to the modern
2.  What is a city? What is modernity?
3.  History of the European city I: up to 1650
4.  History of the European city II: up to the 19th century
5.  History of the European city III: the 19th century
6.  Cities and the Making of Modern Europe
7.  Discussing the modern I
8.  Discussing the modern II
9.  Paris and the 19th century
10.  Paris, capital of modernity
11.  Victorian London
12.  The city as a work of art: London, Paris, Vienna
13.  Urban landscapes of modernity
14.  Writing the city: cities in literature
15.  Cinema and the modern city
16.  Berlin modern
17.  Lisbon, Madrid, Venice, Prague: aspects of the modern I
18.  Moscow & Rome: aspects of the modern II

grading.note: Feedback (questions, journals, summaries of key points with cited quotes in selected texts, commentaries) and class discussion

prerequisite: ◎Available for junior and senior year B.A. program students (Doctoral program courses excepted) and M.A. program students.
